address.description: HTTPS URL of the CipherTrust instance.address can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config.

aws_operation_timeout.description: Some AWS key operations, for example, replication, can take some time to complete. This specifies how long to wait for an operation to complete in seconds. aws_operation_timeout can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is 480.

azure_operation_timeout.description: Azure key operations can take time to complete. This specifies how long to wait for an operation to complete in seconds. azure_operation_timeout can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is 240.

domain.description: CipherTrust domain of the user. domain can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is root.

hsm_operation_timeout.description: HSM connection operations are not synchronous. This specifies how long to wait for an operation to complete in seconds. hsm_operation_timeout can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is 60.

log_file.description: Log file name. log_file can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is ctp.log.

log_level.description: Logging level. log_level can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is info. Options: debug, info, warning or error.

no_ssl_verify.description: Set to false to verify the server's certificate chain and host name. no_ssl_verify can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is true.

password.description: Password of a CipherTrust user. password can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config.

rest_api_timeout.description: CipherTrust rest api timeout in seconds. rest_api_timeout can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config. Default is 60.

username.description: Username of a CipherTrust user. username can be set in the provider block, or in ~/.ciphertrust/config.

access_key_id.description: AWS Key ID of the AWS user. Default is the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID environment variable.

cloud_name.description: Name of the cloud. Options: aws, aws-us-gov and aws-cn. Default is aws.

meta.description: Optional end-user or service data stored with the connection.

secret_access_key.description: Secret associated with the access key of the AWS user. Default is the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY environment variable.

arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key.

auto_rotate.description: Enable AWS autorotation on the key. Default is false.

bypass_policy_lockout_safety_check.description: Bypass the AWS key policy lockout safety check. Default is false.

customer_master_key_spec.description: Specifies a symmetric key or an asymmetric key pair and the encryption algorithms or signing algorithms the key supports. Valid values: SYMMETRIC_DEFAULT, RSA_2048, RSA_3072, RSA_4096, ECC_NIST_P256, ECC_NIST_P384, ECC_NIST_P521 and ECC_SECG_P256K1. Default is SYMMETRIC_DEFAULT.

enable_key.description: Enable or disable the key. Default is true.

key_usage.description: Specifies the intended use of the key. RSA key options: ENCRYPT_DECRYPT, SIGN_VERIFY. Default is ENCRYPT_DECRYPT. EC key options: SIGN_VERIFY. Default is SIGN_VERIFY. Symmetric key options: ENCRYPT_DECRYPT. Default is ENCRYPT_DECRYPT.

kms.description: Name or ID of the kms. Required unless replicating a multi-user key.

multi_region.description: Creates or identifies a multi-region key.

origin.description: Source of the CMK's key material.  Options: AWS_KMS, EXTERNAL. Defaults to AWS_KMS. AWS_KMS will create an AWS key with key material. EXTERNAL will create an AWS key with no key material and is required to import key material.

primary_region.description: Update primary region of a multi-region key. Can only be set for the primary key.

region.description: AWS region in which to create or replicate a key.

schedule_for_deletion_days.description: Waiting period after the key is destroyed before the key is deleted. Default is 7.

tags.description: A list of key:value pairs to assign to the key.

disable_encrypt.description: Disable encryption on the old key.

dsm_domain_id.description: DSM domain ID, required if key_source is dsm.

job_config_id.description: ID of the scheduler job that will perform key rotation.

key_source.description: Source of the key material. Options: dsm, ciphertrust.

block.description: Enable the key for scheduled rotation job.

dsm_domain_id.description: Domain for the DSM key. Required if source_key_tier is dsm.

source_key_name.description: Name of the key created for key material.

source_key_tier.description: Source of the key. Options: local and dsm. Default is local.

valid_to.description: Date of key material expiry in UTC time in RFC3339 format. For example, 2022-07-03T14:24:00Z.

block.description: Key policy to attach to the AWS key. Policy and key administrators, key_users, and AWS accounts are mutually exclusive. Specify either the policy or any one user at a time. If no parameters are specified, the default policy is used.

import_key_material.description: Import key material to a replicated external key.

key_expiration.description: Enable key expiration of the replicated key. Only applies to external keys.

make_primary.description: Update the primary key region to the replicated key's region following replication.

valid_to.description: Date the key material of the replicated key expires. Only applies to external keys. Set as UTC time in RFC3339 format. For example, 2022-07-03T14:24:00Z.

source_key_identifier.description: DSM or CipherTrust key ID to upload to AWS.

source_key_tier.description: Source of the key. Options: local and dsm. Default is local.

valid_to.description: Date of key expiry in UTC time in RFC3339 format. for example, 2022-07-03T14:24:00Z.

aws_connection.description: Name or ID of the AWS connection.

regions.description: A list of AWS regions to be added.

kms.description: Name or ID of the KMS to be used to create the key policy.

client_id.description: Unique Identifier (client ID) for the Azure application. Default is the ARM_CLIENT_ID environment variable.

client_secret.description: Secret key for the Azure application. Default is the ARM_CLIENT_SECRET environment variable.

cloud_name.description: Name of the cloud. Options: AzureCloud, AzureGermanCloud, AzureChinaCloud and AzureUSGovernment. Default is AzureCloud.

meta.description: Optional end-user or service data stored with the connection.

tenant_id.description: Tenant ID of the Azure application. Default is the ARM_TENANT_ID environment variable.

activation_date.description: Date of key activation in UTC time in RFC3339 format. For example, 2021-07-03T14:24:30Z.

curve.description: Curve name for an EC or EC-HSM elliptical key. Options: P-256, P-384, P-521, SECP256K1. Default is P-256.

enable_key.description: Enable or disable the key. Default is true.

expiration_date.description: Date of key expiry in UTC time in RFC3339 format. for example, 2022-07-03T14:24:00Z.

id.description: Concatenation of vault name and key name.

key_ops.description: Allowed key operations. RSA/RSA-HSM key options: encrypt, decrypt, sign, verify, wrapKey, unwrapKey and import. EC key options: sign and verify. Import is applicable only for RSA-HSM keys and mandatory to be set when creating a Key Encryption Key. Default for RSA keys is encrypt, decrypt, sign, verify, wrapKey and unwrapKey. Default for EC keys is sign and verify.

key_size.description: Size for RSA keys. Options: 2048, 3072, 4096. Default is 2048.

key_type.description: The type of key to create. EC      - Elliptic Curve key, RSA     - RSA key, EC-HSM  - Elliptic Curve key for premium key vaults only, RSA-HSM - RSA key for premium key vaults only. Default is RSA.

tags.description: A list of key:value pairs to assign to the key.

vault.description: Name or ID of the vault.

version_count.description: Number of versions of the key.

dsm_domain_id.description: ID of the domain in which DSM keys will be created.

enable_key.description: Enable the rotated key. Default is true.

hsm_partition_id.description: ID of the partition in which HSM keys will be created.

job_config_id.description: ID of the scheduler job that will perform key rotation.

key_source.description: Source of the key material. Only native is valid for EC keys. Options: native, ciphertrust, dsm and hsm-luna.

block.description: Enable the key for scheduled rotation job. Note: Key rotation can cause drift.

dsm_key_id.description: DSM key ID to upload to Azure. Required if source_key_tier is dsm.

hsm.description: Premium vaults support hsm-backed keys. Set to true to use this option.

hsm_key_id.description: Luna-HSM key identifier of the key to be uploaded to Azure. Required if source_key_tier is hsm-luna

kek_kid.description: Identifier of an Azure key encrypting key.

local_key_id.description: CCKM key identifier of the key uploaded to Azure. Required if source_key_tier is local.

pfx.description: Pfx file to upload. Required if source_key_tier is pfx.

pfx_password.description: PFX password. Specify only if the PFX certificate is provided.

source_key_tier.description: Options: local, pfx, dsm and hsm-luna. Default is local.

azure_connection.description: Name or ID of the Azure connection.

name.description: Name of an existing Azure vault.

algorithm.description: Algorithm of the key. Options: AES, EC and RSA.

curve.description: Curve for an EC key. Options: secp256k1, secp384r1, secp521r1 and prime256v1. Default is secp384r1.

key_size.description: Required for RSA keys. Optional for AES keys. Defaults to 256 for AES keys.

domain_id.description: If the DSM user is restricted to a domain, provide the domain id.

meta.description: Optional end-user or service data stored with the connection.

certificate.description: SSL certificate string or filename containing the certificate of DSM Server for TLS communication.

dsm_connection.description: Name or ID of the DSM connection.

algorithm.description: Algorithm of the key. Options: RSA1024, RSA2048, RSA3072, SA4096, AES256, AES128, ARIA128 and ARIA256.

domain.description: ID of the DSM domain in which to create the key.

encryption_mode.description: Encryption mode is required for AES symmetric keys only. Options: CBC, CBC_CS1 and XTS.

expiration_date.description: Date of key expiry in UTC time in RFC3339 format. for example, 2021-07-03T14:24:001Z.

extractable.description: The key is extractable from the DSM.

object_type.description: Object type of the key. Options: asymmetric and symmetric.

hostname.description: Hostname/IP of the Luna Network HSM Server.

is_ha_enabled.description: This flag signifies if it is HighAvailability(HA) Group or not. Requires at least two HSM partitions.

meta.description: Optional end-user or service data stored with the connection.

partition_password.description: Password associated with the Luna Network HSM partition.

server_id.description: ID of the HSM network server.

partition_label.description: Label of a partition on the Luna Network HSM Server.

attributes.description: Key attributes. Options: CKA_ENCRYPT, CKA_DECRYPT, CKA_WRAP, CKA_UNWRAP, CKA_SIGN, CKA_VERIFY and CKA_DERIVE.

mechanism.description: Mechanism of the key. Options: CKM_RSA_FIPS_186_3_AUX_PRIME_KEY_PAIR_GEN, CKM_RSA_X9_31_KEY_PAIR_GEN, CKM_RSA_FIPS_186_3_PRIME_KEY_PAIR_GEN and CKM_RSA_PKCS_KEY_PAIR_GEN.

partition_id.description: Partition ID in which the key will be created.

private_key_id.description: ID of the private key. Second ID in the resourceID string.

public_key_id.description: ID of the public key. First ID in the resourceID string.

hsm_connection.description: Name or ID of the HSM connection.

description.description: Description of the Luna Network HSM server.

hostname.description: Hostname/IP of the Luna Network HSM Server.

hsm_certificate.description: Luna Network HSM Server Certificate downloaded from the HSM. String or a filename containing the certificate.

id.description: CipherTrust Luna Network HSM server ID.

meta.description: Optional end-user or service data stored with the server.

disabled.description: Disable the job configuration. Defaults to false.

end_date.description: Date the job configuration becomes inactive. RFC3339 format, for example, 2021-07-03T14:24Z.

operation.description: Type of operation. Currently, only cckm_key_rotation is supported. Default is cckm_key_rotation.

run_at.description: Described using the cron expression format: '* * * * * 'These five values indicate when the job should be executed. They are in order of minute, hour, day of month, month, and day of week. Valid values are 0-59 (minutes), 0-23 (hours), 1-31 (day of month), 1-12 or jan-dec (month), and 0-6 or sun-sat (day of week). Names are case-insensitive. For example, To run on Saturday at 23:45(11:45 PM): '45 23 * * 6' or '45 23 * * sat' To run on the first of the month at 09:00: '0 9 1 * *'

run_on.description: Use 'any' to run the rotation job on any node in the cluster. Use a specific node ID to run the rotation job on that node. Default is 'any'.

start_date.description: Date the job configuration becomes active. RFC3339 format, for example, 2021-07-03T14:24:00Z.

aws_retain_alias.description: Retain the alias and timestamp on the archived key after rotation.

cloud_name.description: Name of the cloud where rotation operation will be triggered. Current possible values are 'aws' or 'AzureCloud'.

expiration.description: Expiration time of the new key. If not specified, the new key material never expires. For example, if you want the scheduler to the rotate keys that are expiring within six hours of its run, set expire_in to 6h. Use either 'Xd' for x days or 'Yh' for y hours.

expire_in.description: Period during which certain keys are going to expire. The scheduler rotates the keys that are expiring in this period. If not specified, the scheduler rotates all the keys. For example, if you want the scheduler to rotate the keys that are expiring within six hours of its run, set expire_in to 6h. Use either 'Xd' for x days or 'Yh' for y hours.

account_id.description: AWS account ID managed by the connection.

aws_connection.description: Name or ID of the AWS connection.

regions.description: AWS regions available for the account.

validate.description: Validate that the AWS account is already managed by a connection.

azure_connection.description: Name or ID of the Azure connection.
